title: Bond-Yield Surge Challenges Investor Confidence in Big Tech Companies
sub_head: Treasury yields are climbing at their fastest pace in months, testing investors’ faith in popular stocks such as Microsoft, Google parent Alphabet and Nvidia
body:
A swift rise in government-bond yields is hitting shares of technology stalwarts that have powered major indexes higher for years, testing investors’ faith in some of the stock market’s most popular trades.
Even though this week’s slide moderated on Wednesday, shares of software giant Microsoft Corp. , Google parent Alphabet Inc . and chip maker Nvidia Corp. have fallen about 5% or more so far this week, dragging down major indexes and equity funds that give companies with large market values greater influence. Together with Apple Inc., Amazon.com Inc . , Facebook Inc . and Netflix Inc . , the seven companies lost about $315 billion in market value Tuesday, the largest slide since last October, according to Dow Jones Market Data. The S&P 500 inched up 0.2% Wednesday but is still down 3.6% in September and on track for its largest monthly decline in a year.
